Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw a variety of habitats, such as forests with trees and bushes, and ponds with water and plants like algae.
The student can illustrate different living things within each habitat, showing animals like lizards and squirrels in the forest and fish and clams in the pond.
The student can effectively show comparisons by highlighting differences in plant and animal diversity across these habitats, such as varying tree heights or animal sizes.
The student can observe and represent patterns, demonstrating how plant and animal diversity differs between land and water habitats.
The student organizes and labels each drawing clearly, indicating the habitat type and examples of living things found there.
CANNOT: The student may occasionally overlook minor elements, such as the specific types of plants found in a less familiar habitat like a desert (minor omission).
The student might incorrectly label an animal or plant by occasionally mixing up species names or categories (minor classification error).
